results.title: Bud and Lou
results.creator_credit: Robert C Thompson, Clyde B Phillips and Bob Balaban
results.brief_description: This is a biographical made for television feature length film based on the book “Bud & Lou” by Bob Thomas which attempts to portray both the personal and professional lives of the comedic partnership of Bud Abbott and Lou Costello. It follows their career from the Burlesque days, through to broadway, radio, Hollywood and eventually television, entertaining millions along the way. They were renowned for their generosity to charitable causes and were heavily involved with the War Bond drives during WWII but each had their own personal demons to deal with including Lou’s problem with gambling and Bud’s problems with drinking and epilepsy. Harvey Korman stars as Bud Abbott, Buddy Hackett as Lou Costello, and Arte Johnson plays their loyal agent Eddie Sherman. Cast also includes Michele Lee (as Lou’s wife), Robert Reed, Donald Hotton, Harry Solin.

results.title: Buffalo soldiers
results.creator_credit: Charles Haid, Gordon Wolf and Turner Pictures Worldwide
results.brief_description: A group of African-American cavalrymen ride into a desolate, racist and inhospitable frontier town. The town dishonours them, their Native American foes honour them, as Apache leader Victorio gives the soldiers a name of honour and strength, Buffalo Soldiers. The trooper’s daring hunt for Victorio (Harrison Lowe) frames this stirring tribute to the former slaves and other African- Americans of the 9th and 10th U.S Cavalry Regiments. Cast includes Danny Glover, Bob Gunton, Carl Lumbly and Glynn Turman.

results.title: Budgie the little helicopter. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Gary Blatchford, Michael Algar, Fred Wolf Films, HTV, Sarah Ferguson, Duchess of York and Sleepy Kid Company
results.brief_description: Budgie the little helicopter and his friends embark on four fun-filled adventures. In “The Airshow”, Budgie leads the fly past at the Harefield Airshow. Crooks try to steal a French plane called Genevieve and Budgie saves the day. A catch of lobsters almost gets the best of Budgie in “Budgie takes a catch”. Budgie gets to spend a night on an aircraft destroyer in “All at sea”. The final story “Boats, boots and Budgie” sees the intrepid helicopter rescue a cow during bad floods.

results.title: Bruiser
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Ben Barenholtz, Peter Grunwald and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: The premise of writer/director George A. Romero’s curious revenge fantasy has timid office worker Henry Creedlow (Jason Flemyng) wake up one day to discover that his face has become a featureless white mask. His new found anonymity gives him a surge of power as he proceeds to wreak revenge on anyone that has done him wrong in the past. Free of moral consequence, Henry finds himself spiralling into a murderous rampage as he attempts to regain some of the authority he lost when he was a disrespected office worker and cuckolded husband. As an examination of white male urban angst, Romero heavily plays the metaphor of the blank mask. This white featureless facade pointedly alludes to the alienated individual whose sense of self has been completely eroded by personal circumstances and general societal mores. Any overt reference to Georges Franju’s 1959 eerie horror classic “Eyes without a face” (which also featured an outcast character with a blank white mask as a face) remain conspicuously absent as Bruiser aims for more visceral thrills than it’s eloquent predecessor. Cast includes: Peter Stormare, Leslie Hope, Nina Garbiras.

group_works.title: Bruce Dawe
group_works.creator_credit: Linda Kruger, Robin Hughes, Film Australia and SBS-TV

results.title: Bruce Dawe
results.creator_credit: Linda Kruger, Robin Hughes, Film Australia and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian biography”.
An intimate encounter with the extraordinary “poet of suburbia”, Bruce Dawe, whose ability to evoke the drama and beauty of everyday life has set him amongst the most accessible and highly regarded of Australian poets. His highly empathic style of writing stems from a staggered history of variant occupations, contact with those from a diversity of backgrounds and failed studies as he drifted through his early years with a skill for writing but little direction. Here his motivations and writing process as they have since stood are explored. He discusses his family history and early life, his fascinations and motivations and his view of his place in the poetry world of giving a voice to ordinary Australians. Through interviews with Dawe, footage of him reading his poetry and commentary on his life and writing this is a comprehensive personal insight into Bruce Dawe’s life and influences.

results.title: Bronco busters
results.creator_credit: Laurence Hyde and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Scenes of cowboys at the Calgary Stampede roping and riding wild horses captured from the ranges of Southern Alberta, Canada. The film also shows roping a calf, bull-dogging a steer, riding a bull, and a chuck-wagon race.

results.title: Brothers keeper [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Sinofsky, Joe Berlinger, American Playhouse Theatrical Films and Hand to Mouth Productions
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary focuses on a controversial murder trial that took place in the Upstate New York farming community of Munnsville in 1990. 59 year old Delbert Ward, one of four reclusive, eccentric brothers who shared the same dilapidated two-room shack on their dairy farm for over 60 years, was accused of murder when his ailing older brother was found dead in the bed they shared. After being interrogated by the state police, the simple-minded and barely literate Delbert signed a confession stating that he smothered his brother as an act of mercy. Believing him incapable of murder, and not possessing the mental capacity to understand police bureaucracy, the local community rallied around Delbert and his brothers, raising bail in a matter of hours. The film covers the period between Delbert’s arrest and his trial, focusing on the daily lives of the ‘Ward boys’ as national media scrutiny intensifies around them. As the state police gather ‘evidence’ that incest was a motive for the killing, the local community’s support for the outcast Ward brothers strengthens. Interviews with state police and prosecuters, local residents and Delbert’s lawyer build the case for and against the accused. An intriguing, compelling and unashamedly subjective real-life murder mystery that goes beyond simply telling a good story to reveal the part the media plays in the formation of personal and community identity.

results.title: Brother sun sister moon
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Luciano Perugia and Euro International
results.brief_description: This delicate, handsome, quasi-fictional biography of one of the great saints of the Catholic Church, Francis of Assisi, focuses on the early years of his life. Saint Francis, who sought communion with the natural world by renouncing his family;s riches to seek his own destiny unencumbered by material possessions. Francis was, in a sense, history’s first “drop-out” ; he left a life of comfort to seek a spiritual union with the world. Starring Graham Faulkner as Francis and Judi Bowker as the young girl who eventually sheds her materialistic existence for religious poverty, this visually stunning film was nominate for a Best Art Direction Academy Award in 1973.

results.title: Brother bear
results.creator_credit: Aaron Blaise, Bob Walker and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Disney animated feature film about North American Indian boy Kenai (voice by Joaquin Phoenix) who is mysteriously transformed into a bear. Kenai then has to view the world through the eyes of the bear, providing him (and the viewer) with important lessons in life. He is befriend by a bear cub, Koda, who accompanies him through his journey, encountering a range of other wildlife and humans along the way. Features songs by Phil Collins.
